Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2009 06:53PM Maura-Elizabeth wrote: That now discontinued protocol of autologous bone marrow is what bought my mom that 16 years.
Posts.Title: Anyone 10 or 20 year surviror at this Stage TLF Padiddle

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2009 06:46PM Maura-Elizabeth wrote: My mother recently passed away but was almost a 16 yr survivor, first diagnosed in 1994  with Stage IV ER+ and 21 nodes and bone mets at her first diagnosis -- she really fought a mean fight and lived as a survivor ;-)
Posts.Title: Anyone 10 or 20 year surviror at this Stage TLF Padiddle

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2009 06:50PM Maura-Elizabeth wrote: Mets in the lining of the brain mentioned above I think is called meningeal or leptomeningeal carcinamatosis.  The pathologists used to call it "Cake Icing" and see cancer on the brains of children in the morgue.  People generally (in breast, certain small cells carcenomas and small cell lung and melanoma) who could have gotten this kind of brain metastises generally did not live long enough to get it so it was a youth thing. Now it is more common as people live longer.
Posts.Title: Anyone 10 or 20 year surviror at this Stage TLF Padiddle

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2009 12:26PM Maura-Elizabeth wrote: Don't forget to pray along with all of us FOR YOU and your Children -- and know that many of us are here for you.  My mother is now in her last days from her brain mets and LMC.    She is comfortable and happy --- we (she and I) are here for you - I told her about you but she may not understand that you had she have the same illness as she tells me she feels great - there is no pain- and she is happy - but she will pray for you and your lovely children ;-) That might be the best prayer of all.
